title: Critical Fortinet FortiWeb WAF Bug Exploited in the Wild
summary: The article discusses a severe vulnerability found in Fortinet's FortiWeb Web Application Firewall (WAF), which has been actively exploited by attackers. Identified as CVE-2021-26122, the vulnerability allows unauthenticated remote code execution due to improper neutralization of special elements in input data. Researchers emphasize the critical nature of this flaw, urging users to immediately apply the necessary patches released by Fortinet to mitigate potential risks. title: Digital Doppelgangers: Anatomy of Evolving Impersonation Campaigns Distributing Gh0st RAT
summary: The article "Digital Doppelgangers: Anatomy of Evolving Impersonation Campaigns Distributing Gh0st RAT" explores how cybercriminals are increasingly using advanced impersonation tactics to distribute the Gh0st Remote Access Trojan (RAT). These campaigns cleverly mimic legitimate entities, often through email spoofing and fake websites, to deceive targets into downloading the malware. title: A Surveillance Mandate Disguised As Child Safety: Why the GUARD Act Won't Keep Us Safe
summary: The article critiques the GUARD Act, framing it as a surveillance measure masked as a child safety initiative. It argues that while the act is purportedly designed to protect children, its true aim is to expand government surveillance capabilities, potentially infringing on individual privacy rights. Critics highlight that the act could lead to increased monitoring and data collection without effectively addressing the root causes of threats to child safety. The piece emphasizes the need for legislation that genuinely prioritizes children's safety without compromising the civil liberties of individuals.

title: Sniffing out TruffleHog in AWS
summary: TruffleHog is a tool used to detect sensitive information, such as API keys and passwords, that may be accidentally committed to source code repositories. title: Lawmakers Want to Ban VPNs—And They Have No Idea What They're Doing
summary: In the article "Lawmakers Want to Ban VPNs—And They Have No Idea What They're Doing," the author discusses the recent efforts by certain lawmakers to ban the use of Virtual Private Networks (VPNs), despite a limited understanding of the technology.
